sen.j: 花園天皇宸記（はなぞのてんのうしんき）は、花園天皇の日記。
sen.e: Hanazono Tenno Shinki is a diary of Emperor Hanazono.
Hanazono Tenno Shinki is a diary of Emperor Hanazono.

sen.j: 延慶 (日本)3年（1310年）10月から正慶元年/元弘2年（1332年）11月にわたる23年間から成る日記。
sen.e: The diary covers twenty three years from October 1310 to November 1332.
The diary covers twenty three years from October 1310 to November 1332.
The diary covers twenty three years from October 1310 to November 1332 (old calendar).

sen.j: 鎌倉時代後期の貴重な史料。
sen.e: It is an important historical material in the late Kamakura period.
It is an important historical material in the late Kamakura period.
It is an important historical material in the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: 花園天皇自身はこの日記を『等閑記』と称している。
sen.e: Emperor Hanazono himself called this diary "Tokanki."

sen.j: 『花園天皇日記』『花園院宸記』など別称が多いが、『国書総目録』（岩波書店刊）では“はなぞのいんしんき”の項にまとめて記載がある。
sen.e: Though there are many variant titles such as "Emperor Hanazono Diary" and "Hanazono In Shinki," the book was entered under the title of "Hanazono In Shinki" in "A Complete Catalogue of Books in Japanese" (published by Iwanami Shoten)

sen.j: 翻刻には３点あり、刊行順に『列聖全集』（列聖全集編纂会,1915-1917、底本は旧家秘蔵本）、『史料大成続編』33,34（内外書籍,1938、底本は概ね『列聖全集』）、『史料纂集』62,66,80（続群書類従完成会,1982-1986、底本は宮内庁書陵部本）である。
sen.e: There are three kinds of reprint books as follows (in the order of published date): "Ressei Zenshu (Complete Works of Canonized People)" (Ressei Zenshu Compilation Committee, 1915-1917, based on the treasured books of old families), "Grand Collection of Historical Materials, Continued" 33, 34 (Naigai Shoseki, 1938, mostly based on "Ressei Zenshu"), and "Historical Materials Compiled" 62, 66, 80, (Classified Documents, Continued Completing Committee, 1982-1986, based on the book owned by the Archive and Mausolea Department, Imperial Household Agency).

sen.j: なお、1965年に臨川書店より刊行された『増補史料大成』（ここでは2,3巻）は『史料大成』の復刻版の意味合いが強い。

sen.j: 現存部分のほとんどが花園天皇宸翰である。
sen.e: Most of the extant manuscripts were written in the Emperor Hanazono's own hand.

sen.j: また、特に正中の変・元弘の変などに関する記事が豊富かつ詳細であるため、後醍醐天皇の活動状況を研究する上での基本史料となっている。
sen.e: It is an essential historical material to study Emperor Godaigo's activities because of its rich and detailed records on the Shochu Incident and Genko Incident.
